title: UN Security Council turns down request for Nord Stream inquiry
description: Questions remain over explosions in September that damaged gas pipelines connecting Russia and Germany.

title: Brazilian teenager accused of fatally stabbing Sao Paulo teacher
description: Brazilian media outlets say the 13-year-old suspect appeared to be inspired by a deadly school shooting in 2019.

title: Will Vladimir Putin go nuclear in Ukraine?
description: The Russian president said he will deploy nuclear weapons in neighbouring Belarus.

title: Kenya police fire tear gas to disperse anti-government protesters
description: Thousands of protesters march in Nairobi against the rising cost of living despite the government ban on rallies.

title: Biden signs executive order restricting use of commercial spyware
description: The decision comes as governments around the world face accusations of using spyware to target dissidents.

title: Ecuador: At least 16 dead after heavy rainfall causes landslide
description: Emergency officials say the massive landslide also injured 16 people in Andean community in central Ecuador.

title: Scientists discover water inside tiny beads of glass on moon
description: Analysis of lunar soil samples shows spheres of glass hold water inside them, scientists have said.

title: China says no conditions on Honduras diplomatic deal
description: Honduras has become the latest Latin American country to open formal ties with Beijing and end relations with Taiwan.

title: Israel PM Netanyahu delays judicial overhaul plan after protests
description: Netanyahu postponed the plan until May, and in the meantime, granted right-wing minister Ben Gvir a new security force.

title: Ecuador landslide kills at least 16, others reported missing
description: Seven people are missing as rescuers clear debris after wave of mud and debris swept through small town of Alausi.

title: 3 children killed in Nashville primary school shooting: Officials
description: Three children suffering gunshot wounds pronounced dead at hospital after shooting on Monday morning.

title: South Africa shocked by prison break of rapist who faked death
description: Recent DNA tests reveal a body found in a prison and believed to be the serial sex offender is someone else.

title: Cuba hails legislative election as ‘victory’ despite criticism
description: Authorities say turnout surpassed 75 percent in weekend vote that did not include any opposition candidates.

title: Kamala Harris begins Africa tour, announces security aid in Ghana
description: The US pledged help for Benin, Ghana, Guinea, Ivory Coast and Togo to tackle violent groups and instability.

title: More than 180 Rohingya refugees land in western Indonesia
description: Hundreds have reached Indonesia since November last year as they escape desperate conditions in Myanmar and Bangladesh.

title: UN mission accuses EU of aiding crimes against humanity in Libya
description: Fact-finding mission says state security forces and armed militia groups have committed a wide array of crimes.

title: Lebanon’s cabinet reverses decision to delay clock change
description: Lebanon has operated in two time zones as some businesses and institutions followed the order and others refused.

title: Mississippi faces ‘long road to recovery’ after deadly tornadoes
description: Residents of storm-stricken southern US state, one of nation's poorest, are grappling with widespread devastation.

title: Iraqi parliament passes controversial vote law amendments
description: Move will increase the size of electoral districts, a decision widely supported by the country's Iran-backed coalition.

title: Scotland’s ruling SNP picks Humza Yousaf to succeed Sturgeon
description: The new party leader is due to be confirmed as first minister by Scottish lawmakers on Tuesday.

title: Ex-Taiwan leader visits China, first such trip since civil war
description: Former President Ma Ying-jeou in Beijing as Taiwan's ruling party accuses him of 'endorsing' Beijing's Taiwan policy.

title: German transport workers stage one of largest strikes in decades
description: Employees are demanding better pay and working conditions as inflation weakens living standards.

title: El Salvador: A nation under hypnosis
description: After a year of President Bukele's state of emergency, a 'new reality' is settling into the country.

title: Black children six times likelier to be strip-searched: UK report
description: An investigation was launched after a Black 15-year-old girl was strip-searched at a London school in 2020.

title: Alibaba founder Jack Ma makes rare public appearance in China
description: The return of China's best-known entrepreneur may help quell concerns of private sector after regulatory crackdown.

title: History Illustrated: Russia and Ukraine, a history of violence
description: Putin thinks Ukraine belongs to Russia based on what happened 1,000 years ago. The Ukrainians could not disagree more.

title: Kenyan opposition leader Odinga says protests on despite police ban
description: Odinga has called for indefinite twice-weekly protests, citing high living costs and electoral malpractice in 2022 vote.

title: Timeline: How Israel’s judicial changes crisis unfolded
description: Israelis have been protesting for months against Netanyahu's proposed judicial changes.

title: Blast near Afghanistan’s foreign ministry kills at least two: NGO
description: Twelve people are also injured in the explosion in downtown Kabul, according to a hospital run by an Italian NGO.

title: Burkina Faso halts France 24 broadcasts after al-Qaeda interview
description: Paris and Ouagadougou's relations have deteriorated sharply since Burkinabe military seized power in an October coup.

title: The judicial change plan that led Israel to political crisis
description: Reports that PM Netanyahu will halt his plans, after weeks of protest and the sacking of his defence minister.

title: Saudi National Bank appoints chairman after Credit Suisse loss
description: SNB acquired almost 9.9 percent of Credit Suisse for $1.46bn in November but has lost more than $1bn on its investment.

title: Taiwan welcomes Czech delegation after Honduras shifts allegiance
description: US allies have been bolstering support for the island despite Honduras's move to cut ties with Taiwan.

title: Myanmar military pledges decisive action against opponents
description: At Armed Forces Day parade, Min Aung Hlaing says 'terror acts' of coup opponents need to be tackled 'for good and all'.

title: ‘Either Imran Khan exists or we do’, says Pakistan home minister
description: Rana Sanaullah's remarks against Khan during a TV interview trigger a sharp reaction from the opposition PTI party.

title: Photos: Mass protests erupt in Israel as it faces ‘an abyss’
description: Sacked defence chief had warned the deep divisions in Israel were threatening to weaken the military.

title: Russia may demand compensation over Nord Stream blasts: Diplomat
description: Dmitry Birichevsky says Moscow intends to continue to insist on a comprehensive and open international probe.

title: Canada’s McCarthyism and the spies stirring a yellow peril scare
description: Anonymously but very effectively, they're peddling racist tropes about the loyalty of Canadians of Chinese descent.

title: Despite a buyer for SVB, default stress haunts banks
description: SVB's purchase by First Citizens gives markets some respite but it's only 'a little bit of calm before the next storm'.

title: Banking turmoil has ‘potential’ to spark global crisis: ANZ CEO
description: Shayne Elliott says it's 'premature' to say Silicon Valley Bank, Credit Suisse woes will cause repeat of 2008 crisis.

title: Afghanistan wins landmark cricket series against Pakistan
description: Afghanistan beat Pakistan by seven wickets in second Twenty20 international and take an unassailable 2-0 lead in series.

title: France’s Borne to meet opposition, unions amid pension crisis
description: Prime minister says her objective is to 'bring calm to' France after violent protests against pension reform plans.

title: China’s Baidu cancels showcase for ChatGPT rival Ernie
description: Beijing-based search engine giant changes showcase to closed-door event for firms, citing 'strong demand'.

title: Nepal suspends two controllers after flights avert midair crash
description: Civil Aviation Authority of Nepal suspends the employees of the air traffic controller department for 'carelessness'.

title: Twitter source code partially leaked online, court filing says
description: GitHub removed code shared without permission after request by social media giant, court filing says.

title: Saudi, Iran foreign ministers to meet during Ramadan
description: Planned meeting comes after Saudi Arabia and Iran signed a deal to restore ties after seven years of estrangement.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 397
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 397th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Picking up the pieces after twin cyclones hit Vanuatu
description: Two Category 4 cyclones hit Vanuatu within 72 hours in early March.

title: China’s rich flee crackdowns for ‘Asia’s Switzerland’ Singapore
description: Chinese wealth is rushing into the Southeast Asian city-state, prompting unease among some locals.

title: Mass protests in Israel after Netanyahu fires defence minister
description: Protesters block highway in Tel Aviv as police scuffle with crowds in front of Netanyahu's home in Jerusalem.

title: North Korea fires ballistic missiles after protesting US drills
description: Pyongyang's latest missile launches come after claiming to have tested nuclear-capable underwater attack drone.
